meanings.sent1: The fawnier always seeks approval from others.
meanings.sent2: The new student was a fawnier, always trying to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The fawnier in the group would compliment everyone nonstop.
meanings.sent4: She was the fawnier of the office, constantly praising her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The fawnier's insincere flattery was transparent to everyone.

meanings.definition: To behave in a servile or obsequious manner.
meanings.sent1: He would fawnier over his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to fawnier just to get on their good side.
meanings.sent3: The waiter would fawnier over the rude customer to avoid complaints.
meanings.sent4: The politician would fawnier to the wealthy donors for campaign funds.
meanings.sent5: The employee decided not to fawnier and instead focused on hard work.

meanings.sent1: Her fawnier behavior made others uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: He received a fawnier gift than anyone else at the party.
meanings.sent4: The fawnier praise was over the top and unnecessary.
meanings.sent5: The fawnier attitude towards the celebrity was annoying to everyone.
